sentences.en: Both of them died in abject poverty.
sentences.cn: 他们两人都于穷困潦倒中死去。

sentences.en: But in an old man who has known joys and sorrows, and has achieved whatever work it was in him to do, the fear of death is somewhat abject and ignoble.
sentences.cn: 然而老年人已经经历各种欢乐和忧伤, 而且成就了他力所能及的一切工作,就他来讲, 怕死就有些低贱而卑鄙了.

sentences.en: He is poor but not abject in his manner.
sentences.cn: 他人虽清贫,但举止并不下作.

sentences.en: He looked back at the abject, silent girl and repeated his question.
sentences.cn: 他转过头看着这个噤若寒蝉的女孩，又重复了一遍他的问题。

sentences.en: He seems to have conceived an abject, unreasoned terror of the Railroad.
sentences.cn: 他好象对铁路公司抱着一种意气消沉, 不可理喻的恐惧心理.

sentences.en: He's anything but an abject coward.
I used to love to think that I was his abject slave.
sentences.cn: 我过去常常爱把自己想成是他的卑贱的奴仆.

sentences.en: People living in abject poverty ( $ 1 per day ) don't limit their fertility.
sentences.cn: 生活在赤贫 ( 每天1美元的生活 ),不限制其生育能力.

sentences.en: She only thought how best to make her visit appear to Eustacia not abject but wise.
sentences.cn: 她只想,怎么才是最好的方法,能让游苔莎认为她这次的访问令人可佩,而不令人可鄙.

sentences.en: The attempt ended in abject failure.
sentences.cn: 这一尝试以不光彩的失败告终.

sentences.en: The fear of death is somewhat abject and ignoble.
sentences.cn: 怕死就未免有些可鄙、有些不光彩了.

sentences.en: The thought of working nights fills me with abject horror.
sentences.cn: 一想到要夜间工作我就觉得惨兮兮的.

sentences.en: This straight forward bullying was met by abject submission.
sentences.cn: 这直接痛快的凌辱遇到的却是卑鄙的屈服.

trans.tran_cn: 卑鄙的，下贱的，（指境况）凄惨的，轻蔑的，被鄙视的，厚颜无耻的
trans.tran_en: an abject action or expression shows that you feel very ashamed
